# Node.js modules
# This is crucial! Contains all your npm installed packages, which are very large.
# They are recreated easily with `npm install`.
node_modules/

# Build outputs
# This is the compiled production-ready code that React creates.
# It's generated by `npm run build`.
build/
dist/ # Another common build output folder name

# Logs
logs
*.log
npm-debug.log*
yarn-debug.log*
yarn-error.log*
lerna-debug.log*

# OS generated files
.DS_Store # macOS specific
Thumbs.db # Windows specific

# Environment variables (React-specific, includes sensitive keys if any)
# React apps typically look for .env.local, .env.development.local etc.
# These should NEVER be committed.
.env
.env.local
.env.development.local
.env.test.local
.env.production.local

# Miscellaneous
.cache/
.eslintcache
